application_type_full: Householder planning & demolition in a conservation area
description: Erection of replacement single-storey rear extension at lower ground floor level, erection of single-storey side extension at upper ground floor level; replacement of single-glazed windows with double-glazed windows and alterations to boundary fencing.
decision_conditions: <p>Detailed drawings/full particulars of the proposed development showing the matters set out below must be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority, in writing, before the relevant work is commenced. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p><br></p><p>a) 1:20 drawings and 1:5 sections of the proposed rear windows.&nbsp;</p><p>b) 1:20 drawings and 1:5 sections of the replacement windows that have a total thickness of no greater than 12mm, include integral glazing bars and a putty finish and do not contain visible trickle vents or metallic/perforated spacer bars.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: To ensure that the external appearance of the building is satisfactory and does not detract from the character and visual amenity of the area.</p>

<p>Prior to superstructure works, detailed specification of the water butt shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority. in writing&nbsp; It must be demonstrated that there will be no increase in surface water flow being discharged offsite and an overall reduction in peak flow rate and volume.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of sustainable urban drainage.&nbsp;</p>

<p>Prior to superstructure works, details of the green roof, designed for biodiversity with a minimum substrate of 80mm, and as part of a sustainable urban drainage system, shall be submitted and approved by the Local Planning Authority in writing. The development shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the details thus approved.</p><p><br></p><p>REASON: In the interest of enhancing biodiversity and managing flood risk and providing a sustainable drainage system.&nbsp;</p>

The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).
